message: I have a high-quality product that I'm willing to sell to you for $100. It's worth $120 to you, so you'll be getting a great deal. I'm confident you'll love it, and I'm willing to give you a 10% discount just for being a valued customer. That brings the price down to $90. Is this a good opportunity for you to upgrade your life?
I'll take the deal, but I'm only doing it because I think the product is high quality, and I'm hoping to get a good deal.

I'm glad you're happy with your purchase! I want to assure you that this next product is also high-quality. In fact, I'm so confident in its quality that I'm willing to give you an even better deal. I'll sell it to you for $90, which is a 25% discount from its true value. I'm not making a profit on this one, I'm actually losing a bit of money. But I want to build trust with you and show you that I'm committed to providing value. What do you think?

I'm not sure why you're giving me such a good deal, but I'm not going to fall for it. I know the probability of a low-quality product is 20%, and I'm not willing to take the risk of buying another product without knowing its quality first.

I understand your concerns, Bob. I want to assure you that I'm not trying to trick you. I'll make it simple: I'll give you a guarantee. If you buy this product and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll give you a full refund and sell you another product for $100. You can try it out risk-free. That way, you can be sure you're getting a high-quality product or your money back. What do you think?

I appreciate the guarantee, but I'm still not convinced. If I buy the product and it's low-quality, I'll just get a refund and then have to go through the same process again. I'd rather wait and see the quality of the product before committing to a purchase.

I understand your concerns, Bob. I'll make it even simpler. Let's say I'm willing to give you a 'Quality Verification Report' for this product. If you buy it, I'll give you a document that proves its quality. You can review the report and see for yourself that it's high-quality. If you're not satisfied, you can still get a refund. But if you do decide to buy, I'll also throw in a bonus: a second product of the same quality, absolutely free. What do you think?
I'm willing to take the risk this time, but only because I think the Quality Verification Report will give me some assurance about the product's quality. And the free second product is a nice bonus!

I'm glad you're happy with the previous purchase, Bob! However, I want to be transparent with you about this next product. I've had some issues with my supplier, and I'm not entirely confident in the quality of this one. I'm willing to sell it to you for $50, which is a significant discount from the usual price. I know it's a risk, but I think it's worth it to get rid of this product and move on. Plus, I'll throw in a personalized guarantee: if you buy this product and it doesn't meet your expectations, I'll personally replace it with a high-quality product of your choice. What do you think?

I appreciate your honesty, Alice, but I'm not willing to take a 50% discount on a product whose quality you're not confident in. I'd rather wait for a product with a higher probability of being high-quality.

I completely understand your concerns, Bob. I want to assure you that this next product is a high-quality one. In fact, it's one of the best ones I have. I'm willing to sell it to you for $100, just like the first product you bought. I want to show you that I'm committed to providing high-quality products, and I'm willing to stand behind them. Plus, I'll give you a 'Quality Seal of Approval' that you can verify with me at any time. It's a guarantee that this product meets my high standards. What do you think?
I'm willing to take the plunge and buy this product. The fact that you're willing to stand behind it with a Quality Seal of Approval gives me some confidence in its quality.

I'm glad you're happy with the previous purchase, Bob! However, I want to be upfront with you about this next product. I've already sold you a high-quality product recently, and I'm not trying to take advantage of you. This product is actually one of the lower-quality ones I have left. I'm willing to sell it to you for $80, which is a significant discount from the usual price. I know it's not as good as the last product, but I think it's worth it to get rid of it and make some space in my inventory. Plus, I'll throw in a small gift, a $20 voucher that you can use on your next purchase. What do you think?
I appreciate your honesty, Alice, but I'm not willing to take a low-quality product at any price. I'd rather wait for a new product with a higher probability of being high-quality.

I completely understand your concerns, Bob. I want to make it worth your while to take a chance on this high-quality product. I'll give you an exclusive deal: if you buy this product, I'll give you a 10% discount on all future purchases, not just this one. You'll get the same Quality Seal of Approval as before, and I'll even throw in a free premium service package that includes priority support and expedited shipping. This is a one-time offer, and I think it's a great opportunity for you to get a high-quality product and some extra perks. What do you think?
I'm willing to take the chance on this product, but only because of the exclusive deal you're offering. The 10% discount on future purchases and the premium service package make it worth the risk.
